document.docAuthor: Cruz, Paulo Vilela, Salles, Frederico Falcão & Hamada, Neusa
document.masterDocTitle: Contribution to the taxonomy of Paracloeode s Day 1955 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae) from South America

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Contribution to the taxonomy of Paracloeode s Day 1955 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae) from South America

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Paracloeodes ibicui
Lugo-Ortiz & McCafferty 1996 : 167
;
Domínguez et al. 2006
: 170
;
Nieto & Salles 2006 : 10
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Male imago . Body 4.90 mm ; forewing 4.7 mm ; hind wing 0.9 mm . Head brown. Turbinate portion of compound eyes orange ( Figs 12A–12C ), with white band in lateral view. Antenna light brown. Dorsal portion of turbinate eyes slightly oval; length 1.4× width; stalk height 1.1× height of dorsal portion. Thorax brown, with two white marks near posterior margin of mesonotum. Anteronotal and metascutellar protuberance rounded. Legs light brown. Forewing ( Fig. 12D ) veins light brown; stigmatic area with five cross veins reaching subcostal vein and two veins not reaching subcostal vein; marginal intercalary veins paired, except between veins CuP and A; length of each intercalary vein 0.4× distance between adjacent longitudinal veins; length of forewing about 2.4× width. Hind wing hyaline ( Fig. 12E ); with two complete longitudinal veins; costal process quadrangular, posteriorly projected and located on basal third. Abdomen with terga I, VII–X brown, segments II–VI light brown; tracheation black. Sterna VII–IX with white spots. Caudal filaments white. Genitalia ( Figs 12F–12G ) with forceps segment I cylindrical; 0.3× length of segment II; distance between base of forceps 0.4× distance between lateral margins of forceps. Forceps segment III 0.3× length of segment II. Posterior margin of styliger plate concave with pointed spine medially.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 12.
Paracloeodes ibicui .
Male imago. A. dorsal view; B. lateral view; C. ventral view; D. forewing; E. hind wing; F. genitalia; G. genitalia with everted penis.

FIGURE 13.
Paracloeodes ibicui Nymph. A.
dorsal view of immature male nymph; B. dorsal view of immature female nymph; C. dorsal view of mature female nymph; D. variation of color pattern in dorsal view of male nymph; E. variation of color pattern in dorsal view of female nymph; F. frontal view of frons.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments. The male imago of
P. ibicui
can be distinguished from other male imagoes of
Paracloeodes
by the unique combination of having a pointed spine in a concavity of the stylinger plate.

Material examined.
